Perceptor:
The resistance was broken, but a hidden virus was activated. If Swichblade couldn't destroy it, this virus would destroy Perceptor's spark... an might destroy Swichblade's
  x_rauq_x <x_rauq_x@...> wrote: -- Switchblade --

Switchblade's spark flashes angrily as it detects resistance. He 
redoubles his efforts, and ferociously attacks the source of this 
resistance, in hopes of quickly overpowering Perceptor quickly and 
effectively.


--- In nbwrpg@y..., "airly2000" <airly2000@y...> wrote:
> Perceptor::
> 
> Perceptor's spark felt that someone was trying to came in bot's 
mind 
> and it tried to block that
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "x_rauq_x" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
> > -- Switchblade --
> > 
> > Switchblade completes Perceptor's head, a perhaps simple design, 
> but 
> > with the current resources, it would suffice. He had no optics 
> > available, and didn't want to spend the time to make them, so he 
> had 
> > implanted a infrared sensor to do for the moment.
> > 
> > He places the head onto Perceptor's upper torso, and brushes off 
> his 
> > hands. "Hmmm..." His precise hands open Perceptor's chest 
> > compartment, and he attaches several cords to specific 
locations. 
> He 
> > then connects those cords to a machine that resembles an 
electric 
> > chair. Switchblade sits in the chair, and draws a few more cords 
to 
> > him and attaches them to the back of his neck, and to his chest.
> > 
> > A few of Nightstrike's strong thoughts of escape nudge at his 
> > concentration, but he shrugs them off, <Later Nightstrike, I've 
got 
> > more important things to attend to...>.
> > 
> > A few key memories need to be deleted from Perceptor's mind. 
> > Switchblade was about to dive in, and make the necessary 
> > corrections. The green glow leaves his optics, and the battle of 
> the 
> > mind begins between Perceptor and Switchblade.
